channel.title: Can't Connect to Xbox Live
channel.description:
Hey guys. Sorry to bother you, but I can't connect to Xbox Live. I got the free 1 month card and everything, but it won't connect. I have a network. I have a wireless adapter and router. What else do I need? Is it because of RROD? If it is, then I'd have to connect to it wired, and it would be really hard since I have to have the cable for the computer to the Xbox AND I have to plug in the Xbox 360 to the TV, it's not even near my computer.
Please guys, I want to go on Xbox Live bad. (Wow I sound like a 5 year old...)
Also, if this is in the wrong board, can a mod move it? Thanks.

item.title: Can't Connect to Xbox Live
item.dc:creator: @Full_Metalst Full Metalst
item.description:
@Full_Metalst wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:28, topic:289343”][quote author=Full Metalst link=topic=382507.msg2874760#msg2874760 date=1247978644]

Or the most simple answer GET RID OF YOUR WIRELESS!

Orly? Problem has been solved (with wireless). Mod lock please.
[/quote]
How did you solve?[/quote]
Changed WPA key to WEP key with a different network. My dad called Netgear and Microsoft.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Connect to Xbox Live
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Did you know that walls in houses block signals!!! Move the xbox and tv closer to the router and see if that helps. Or you could check if your router even has WiFi.

Read full topic

item.description:

It’s not the adapter. I’m not really sure what the problem is. I think I should bring the Xbox in the family room where the router is. Calling Microsoft should help.

item.title: Can't Connect to Xbox Live
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:20, topic:289343”][quote author=cumescape link=topic=382507.msg2873713#msg2873713 date=1247928614]

[quote author=Niall link=topic=382507.msg2873625#msg2873625 date=1247920738]

[quote author=Full Metalst link=topic=382507.msg2873356#msg2873356 date=1247897521]
PS3’s are gay, and expensive.[/quote]

£50 more than a 360 elite, real expensive… A year or two of xbl and you’re paying more for a 360 than you are a ps3. Also, about the graphics, please find some 360 exclusives that look better than say, MGS4, Uncharted(and 2 when that comes out), wipeout hd etc etc.

But really, if you have tried everything, and nothing is working, you’ll have to send it back to be repaired.

EDIT: or buy a new wireless adapter.
[/quote]Or just GET RID OF WIRELESS.
[/quote][/quote]

It’s not really an option for some people to run a coord through the house for an almost non-existent speed boost.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Connect to Xbox Live
item.dc:creator: @Full_Metalst Full Metalst
item.description:
@Full_Metalst wrote:

cocoa:

Get a PS3

PS3’s are gay, and expensive. You have to buy the memory card, and everything for the internet. Controls are gay. Even with the 100 bucks for the adapter (or the free ethernet cable), the PS3’s are still a lot more expensive, which is bullshit. I’m never buying one. Graphics are the exact same as Xbox 360. Next option please.

I’ve watched YouTube videos, got on xbox.com, didn’t do shit. I’m about to call them and cuss them out (not really, just pissed…) why my Adapter is defective (not working).

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Connect to Xbox Live
item.dc:creator: @Full_Metalst Full Metalst
item.description:
@Full_Metalst wrote:

Stop kidding around.

@cumescape: I tried everything I could, and it didn’t work. I’m connected to the router network, it won’t pick up my signal for some reason. I restarted my router for 30 minutes, nothing. Everything is plugged in correctly. The Xbox 360 is 30-40 ft away from the router, and the Adapter picks up signals up to 75 ft (or so I’ve heard). I guess you do know the problem, and if you do, help me. Don’t just flame me then leave. I AM being ignorant, I’m only 15…

Since I’m gullible, my friend on MSN told me the RRoD (It occured about 3 weeks ago, just got it back) and then he said if I have the RRoD I can’t connect wirelessly or not. Just wanted to know if he was right or not.

Read full topic
